column4: hi guys..>I'm trying to set a static IP in 10.10, but struggling...can anyone help?
what are you trying to do?
set my ubuntu machine to use a static IP address
by using network manager or editing /etc/network/interfaces?
I have opted for 'Manual', and I have entered the IP address I want, the subnet mask of 255.255.255.0, and also the gateway
can you access any machine by *name* ?
what did you put in the "DNS servers:" box?
can you access the other machines by name, or only by ip address ?
can you do, for instance, ping 8.8.8.8 ?
sorry, you're confusing me...I'm not trying to access other machines, although I can already..nothing has changed there
with the IP address or with name?
are you sure you have set the address, netmask, gateway correctly?

you should know what IP address you want to assign to your machine, if you want to use static IP. netmask is often 255.255.255.0 at homes, and gateway is probably the IP address of your router, e.g. 192.168.1.1
but you probably know all that.
